show_hidden_params.description: Show parameters marked as hidden when invoking --help?

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

samples.description: Csv file describing all samples in the analysis run (required!)

runFolder.description: Top-level sequencer run directory (or null when using fastq input)

fastqSamplesheet.description: bcl-convert samplesheet.csv when running from BCL; If null, will be auto-generated based on samples.csv

fastqDir.description: Directory containing pre-generated FASTQs files (or null when using runFolder input)

libStructure.description: Json file describing library structure and index/barcode sequences

outDir.description: Name of the output directory for workflow results

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

genome.description: json file with paths and parameters for the reference genome (required!)

peaks.description: Pre-defined peaks (bed / narrowPeaks) to use for quantification (count matrix output) instead of de-novo peak calls

fastqc.description: Enable fastqc on all input fastq files

trimFastq.description: Enable adapter trimming (if running from Fastq input)

subsample.description: Enable sub-sampling of reads (fastq files) to a fixed depth. Target depth per-sample set in samples.csv

qcAndArchRParams.description: yml file containing parameters for QC and ArchR analysis

generateReport.description: Generate an interactive HTML report of results?

runArchR.description: Attempt to run automated ArchR analysis?

archrCondaEnv.description: Path to created conda environment with ArchR installed

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`
